meanings.definition: To turn or swing around quickly
meanings.sent1: She will swy around to see the surprise.
meanings.sent2: The dancer will swy gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent3: He tried to swy around the corner but bumped into the wall.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees swy back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The carousel made the children feel like they were swying through the air.

meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a powerful swy to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent2: The swy from the hammer echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected swy to the door startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm's swy against the windows was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The swy of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.

meanings.definition: A sudden or violent movement or change
meanings.sent1: The earthquake caused a swy in the ground that shook the entire town.
meanings.sent2: The sudden swy in the stock market left investors worried.
meanings.sent3: The swy in the weather caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: The swy in her mood was noticeable to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The swy in the plot of the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
